*div1 type="summary"* *p*D. W. Smith to Austin, Matamoros, April 18, 1831. Thanks Austin for efforts against the bill to prohibit foreigners engaging in retal trade.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Matamoros */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="04-18-1831">18th April 1831*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col. Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Leona Vicario*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*Dr Sir, Your favours of the *date_mentioned n="03-15-1831">15th ulto*/date_mentioned* and *date_mentioned n="04-19-1831">19th inst.*/date_mentioned* were duly received. The letters which you enclosed in the former, were transmitted to the *location_mentioned*U. States*/location_mentioned* in compliance with your request.*/p*
*p*It is truly gratifying to me, to learn, that there is yet, some prospect of defeating the Law; which the Hon. *person_mentioned*Legislature of your *location_mentioned*State*/location_mentioned* */person_mentioned*has attempted to pass; prohibiting *person_mentioned*Foreigners */person_mentioned*from the privilege of retailing their merchandise a copy of which, you did me the honor to transmit—for your politeness and attention, I beg leave to return you my sincere thanks. If such a law as contemplated, should go into effect, it would most unquestionably, militate materially against the interest of my *location_mentioned*countrymen*/location_mentioned*. Its practical operation would have a similar tendency towards the *person_mentioned*natives */person_mentioned*generally. It would throw the whole trade into the hands of a few *person_mentioned*capitalists*/person_mentioned*; who, availing themselves of the monopoly, could compel the *person_mentioned*consumers */person_mentioned*to pay almost any price for their goods, that their consciences would permit them to ask: in a few words it would benefit the few to the obvious detriment of the many. I have never understood that you was an advocate of that law; nor has any such report been in circulation here, your letter gave me the first report of its supposed existence. The laudable effort made by your *person_mentioned*Legislature*/person_mentioned*, in behalf of this *location_mentioned*Port*/location_mentioned*, will be duly appreciated by every *person_mentioned*friend */person_mentioned*of equal rights and free trade. It is to be hoped, that the open hostility, manifested by the *person_mentioned*citizens of *location_mentioned*Vera Cruz*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, against the growing prosperity of this section, may be tranquilized; and that the interested selfish motives, disclosed in their application to the *person_mentioned*General Congress*/person_mentioned* to close, the*location_mentioned* Port of Matamoros */location_mentioned*may be responded to, in the language of denial.*/p*
*p*The natural advantages, which this place possesses, in point of health, over the *location_mentioned*Southern Ports*/location_mentioned*; the superior facilities in the transportation of merchandise into the *location_mentioned*interior*/location_mentioned*; its contiguity to the *location_mentioned*frontier*/location_mentioned*, and to the *location_mentioned*U. S*/location_mentioned*.; and its importance as a *location_mentioned*military port*/location_mentioned*, claim the consideration and protection of the general Government. Those common advantages to the *location_mentioned*nation*/location_mentioned*, should not be easily yielded by those entrusted with its affairs; nor sacrificed by the cupidity of local jealosy, and self-aggrandizement*/p*.
*p*I have been informed, from a *location_mentioned*quarter */location_mentioned*entitled to credit, that the Commercial Treaty, concluded by the*person_mentioned* American Charge des Affaires at Mexico,*/person_mentioned* with this *person_mentioned*Government*/person_mentioned*, has been ratified by the *person_mentioned*Senate of the *location_mentioned*U. States*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, that the *person_mentioned*American citizens*/person_mentioned* are placed upon an equal footing with those of the most favored *location_mentioned*nation*/location_mentioned*; and that the principle of reciprocity has been fully recognized and established, by the respective *person_mentioned*Governments*/person_mentioned*.—by the next arrival I expect to receive that document.*/p*
*p*The latest accounts from *location_mentioned*Europe*/location_mentioned*, represent the powers that be, in a high state of excitement and commotion—A general war is anticipated on the *location_mentioned*Continent*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I have been confined to my room, by severe indisposition, for some months past; in consequence of which, I have not replied to your communication of the *date_mentioned n="03-15-1831">15th ulto*/date_mentioned* until now, I herewith enclose you a letter from *person_mentioned*capn Henry Austin*/person_mentioned* of *location_mentioned*New Orleans*/location_mentioned*. He directed me to enclose it under cover to some *person_mentioned*friend */person_mentioned*in *location_mentioned*Saltillo*/location_mentioned*, as he apprehended there would be danger of its being intercepted in its progress, provided it went to your address. I have therefore enclosed it to *person_mentioned*Mr. Judah*/person_mentioned*, an intelligent *person_mentioned*merchant */person_mentioned*of that place, and beg leave to recommend him to your particular attention and regard.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*D. W. Smith */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
